intro: Saussurea laneana, commonly known as the Tibetan yellowhead, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and yellowish to brownish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cold and arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Saussurea laneana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
